lines.text: By marrying I can make only one woman miserable. By remaining single I can make so many happy.
How disappointing you look in that dressing gown.
Oh, and I chose the one that suits me best. How depressing; it must be me.
What terribly nice cigarettes.
I'll send you some.
Go into that bathroom and hide. I'll get rid of them!
Thanks, but like many other women, my life has been devoted to not being discovered in bathrooms!
Who's the tall bloke along side the mistress?
The tall bloke, is Lord Elton - a rich, eligible bachelor.
Seems to have an eye to her.
He has two eyes to her.
She's a rather attractive woman, isn't she, Elton?
Well, personally, I prefer the word likable to attractive.
I'd defer. To accuse a beautiful woman of being likable - is to suggest that her under clothes are made of linoleum.
How are you Willie?
All for the merry, old boy, all for the merry. I say, eh, have a little snifter.
Oh, go to the devil!
How disappointing. I thought you were clever, but, you're really rather stupid.
I'm afraid I'm not at all modern. I don't smoke. I don't drink and I don't swear.
Are you a good woman or are you not?
Oh, damn this dickie! The bloody thing's choking me.
Doing anything for a few minutes, Arthur?
I am, but, Willie isn't.
Come and make love to me in the garden, Willie.
Not tonight, Joan. It's too windy.
My word, how I hate my face.
Supposing you had to live with it, like your poor wife has.
I never thought of that. I'll give you a little present.
Thank you, Willie. I deserve it.
I'm afraid our little concert is hardly being appreciated.
Perhaps, they would prefer jazz.
Yes. Yes. And afterwards, what was it George said - We'll live like swells.
Tell me about Australia.
Oh, yes, to be sure. You've been there, of course?
Why, no. No. Unfortunately.
Well, you see, when you are having winter there, you are having summer here.
Oh, jolly odd, that.
I know too much about you. And you know too little about me.
Cheerio, old squirt.
Come. Come. What will you take?

I say, Mrs. Cheyney, when you open that shop, Elton and I will promise you on our word of honor, never to wear anything but women's under clothes. Ha-ha-ha. Frankly, up to this minute, I always believed he did. Ha-ha-ha. Ta-Ta!
Next to going around the world with the woman one loves, I can think of nothing more attractive than going around with Charles.
But, of all the women that you've ever known, none has ever been so glad to see you in a bedroom, as I was last night.
You made an honest woman out of me!
